quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to insert the data into the ''students'' table.
[!raw!]
{0} {1} students
{2} ('John Smith', 'MIT');
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Inserting Data[/h1]

SQL tables store data in rows, one row after another. The [b]INSERT INTO[/b] statement is used to add [b]new rows[/b] of data to a table in the database. 
The SQL INSERT INTO syntax is as follows:[code format="sql" ][b]INSERT INTO[/b] table_name
[b]VALUES [/b](value1, value2, value3,...);[/code]
[note]Make sure the order of the values is in the same order as the columns in the table. [/note]
Consider the following [b]Employees [/b]table: [img id="2844" width="100%"]
Use the following SQL statement to insert a new row:[code format="sql" ][b]INSERT INTO[/b] Employees 
[b]VALUES [/b](8, 'Anthony', 'Young', 35);[/code]
The values are comma-separated and their order corresponds to the columns in the table.
[b]Result: [/b] [img id="2845" width="100%"]
[note]When inserting records into a table using the SQL INSERT statement, you must provide a value for every column that does not have a default value, or does not support NULL.[/note]

quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to insert the data into the ''student'' table, using actual column names.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Inserting Data[/h1]

Alternatively, you can specify the table's column names in the INSERT INTO statement:[code format="sql"]INSERT INTO table_name[b] (column1, column2, column3, ...,columnN)  [/b]
VALUES (value1, value2, value3,...valueN);[/code]
column1, column2, ..., columnN are the names of the columns that you want to insert data into.[code format="sql"]INSERT INTO Employees[b] (ID, FirstName, LastName, Age) [/b]
VALUES (8, 'Anthony', 'Young', 35);[/code]
This will insert the data into the corresponding columns: [img id="2845" width="100%"]
[note]You can specify your own column order, as long as the values are specified in the same order as the columns.[/note]

answers.text: The number of columns in the insert statement and the number of columns of the table MUST be the same
Names of the columns MUST always be mentioned in the insert statement
We don't have to insert values for the all columns in the table

quizzes.question: When inserting data into a table:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Inserting Data[/h1]

It is also possible to insert data into [b]specific[/b] columns only. [code format="sql" ]INSERT INTO Employees (ID, FirstName, LastName) 
VALUES (9, 'Samuel', 'Clark');[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2846" width="100%"]
[note]The [i]Age [/i]column for that row automatically became [b]0[/b], as that is its default value.[/note]
